docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton picked up another powerful superdelegate Tuesday, Rep. Ike Skelton of Missouri, chairman of the House Armed Services Committee.
docs.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton picks up another superdelegate in Rep. Ike Skelton of Missouri, but one Obama supporter says most members of Congress are, at least in private, lining up for her opponent.
docs.snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton picks up another superdelegate in Rep. Ike Skelton of Missouri, but one Obama supporter says most members of Congress are, at least in private, lining up for her opponent.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Service Employees International Union filed a federal lawsuit in Los Angeles, accusing the president and nine other leaders of its giant health care local in California of breaching their fiduciary duties. The lawsuit accused them of setting up an educational fund that the parent union said was used to spend money for internal political purposes off the books and without proper accountability. The lawsuit comes as Sal Rosselli, the president of the California local, United Healthcare Workers-West, has accused Andrew L. Stern, the S.E.I.U.’s president, of being undemocratic. Jonathan Siegel, a lawyer for the local, said its board had approved the creation of the fund and dissolved it last week and returned all the money, some of which was used to educate the local’s nearly 150,000 members about the push for universal health coverage in California.

headline.main: California: Union Files Suit Against Local
headline.print_headline: California: Union Files Suit Against Local

docs.lead_paragraph: Industrial hygienists, educators, residents and others testified at a City Council hearing on Tuesday against a bill that would make the New York the first city in the nation to require certain chemical, biological and radiation detectors to be registered with the Police Department.Police officials appearing before the Committee on Public Safety said the bill would minimize the risk of false alarms about a biological or chemical attack that could disrupt broad areas of the city.

headline.main: Both Sides Are Heard in Police-Air Monitor Debate

docs.abstract: Industrial hygienists, educators and others spoke out against a Police Department plan to require registration of privately owned monitors that detect radiation and biological attacks.
docs.snippet: Industrial hygienists, educators and others spoke out against a Police Department plan to require registration of privately owned monitors that detect radiation and biological attacks.

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated As Senator John McCain spends the week talking about health care and health insurance coverage, the Service Employees International Union has begun broadcasting an ad against his plans in Ohio and Washington, D.C.

headline.main: Union Ad Criticizes McCain on Health Care

docs.abstract: The S.E.I.U. couples a promotional bus tour to revamp health care with a new ad slamming McCain's proposals.
docs.snippet: The S.E.I.U. couples a promotional bus tour to revamp health care with a new ad slamming McCain's proposals.

docs.lead_paragraph: TAMPA - Senator John McCain plans to offer more details here Tuesday about how his health care plan would work for people with pre-existing health problems, an area where he has stark differences with the Democratic candidates.
docs.abstract: The Republican candidate rolls out details of his proposal at an appearance in Florida.
docs.snippet: The Republican candidate rolls out details of his proposal at an appearance in Florida.

docs.lead_paragraph: John McCain is set to spend the bulk of this week talking up his health care reform plan -- he'll speak at a cancer center in Tampa this morning -- and he also has a new ad to push his message.
docs.abstract: In his new TV ad, John McCain pushes his plan to give a tax credit to American families so they can choose their own health insurance.
docs.snippet: In his new TV ad, John McCain pushes his plan to give a tax credit to American families so they can choose their own health insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: Barack Obama hasn't requested any federal earmarks for 2009. John McCain, in fact, hopes to banish all earmarks forever.
docs.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton's request for more than $2 billion in earmarks for 2009 is a sharp contrast from her opponents' decision not to request any.
docs.snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton's request for more than $2 billion in earmarks for 2009 is a sharp contrast from her opponents' decision not to request any.
